solution: We see that $(7b^3)^2 = 7^2 \cdot b^{3\cdot2} = 49 \cdot b^6.$ Likewise, $(4b^2)^{-3} = 4^{-3} \cdot b^{-6}.$ Now, $(7b^3)^2 \cdot (4b^2)^{-3} = 49 \cdot b^6 \cdot 4^{-3} \cdot b^{-6},$ and since $4^{-3} = \frac{1}{64},$ we have $\frac{49}{64} \cdot b^6 \cdot b^{-6} = \boxed{\frac{49}{64}},$ since $b^0 = 1$ for all non-zero $b.$
